title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 2. Regulation 5 of the European Union (International Labour Organisation
text_raw:
2. Regulation 5 of the European Union (International Labour Organisation 
Work in Fishing Convention) (Safe Manning) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 52 of 
2024) is amended by substituting for paragraph (13) the following: 

“(13) Notwithstanding the revocation of the Fishing Vessels (Certification of 
Deck Officers and Engineer Officers) Regulations 1988 (S.I. No. 289 of 1988), 
the Merchant Shipping (Safe Manning, Hours of Work and Watchkeeping) 
Regulations 1998 (S.I. No. 551 of 1998) and the European Union (International 
Labour Organisation Work in Fishing Convention) (Safe Manning) Regulations 
2023 (S.I. No. 315 of 2023), any minimum safe manning document issued to a 
fishing vessel pursuant to any of those Regulations shall continue in force.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 August, 2025. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 
Minister for Transport. 

1 OJ L 25, 31.1.2017, p. 12 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 12th August, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [394] 3

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations confirm that, notwithstanding the revocation of the European 
Union (International Labour Organisation Work in Fishing Convention) (Safe 
Manning) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 315 of 2023), any safe manning document 
issued under those regulations continues in force. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [394]
